channel.title: Runescape webclient fullscreen for non-members. userscript
channel.description:
i got bored yesterday so i decided to mess around. i hope this isnt breaking the rules since this is javascript and not a higher-level programming language.
all this stuff in this paragraph really isnt important if u dont want to read it just skip on down to the next paragraph. well right now in my college class we are doing a little bit of javascripting. not really anything just getting use familiar with the way programming is b4 we actually learn how to program(right now the course is still learning about computer and Internet concepts). not saying im just now learning this stuff its just review b/c when i first got interested in programming from this site here, i really was a noob. kept trying to learn java, but didnt want to take the time to read through the tuts and stuff. so i read shorter tuts on w3schools.com about html and javascript. so for the stuff we are doing right now im a little advanced for but thats cool its an easy A; but i am learning little things here and there. i am not saying i know everything, b/c i am far from that. i am learning every day which we should all do. sorry for the little story i get side tracked easy.
ok. like the title says i created a userscript that redirects you to the src of the iframe in the www.runescape.com/game.ws page, then removes the scripts from that new page, removes the ads src, resizes the ad, hides the ad area and menubar, and finally sets the position of the applet to 0,0. for this to work u must have both userscripts for this to work and you must also have your client set to resizable. u can leave the web browser like that or hit f11 or click the button to make it fullscreen.
share folder link: [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?ugbmat37g2ug3]http://www.mediafire.com/?ugbmat37g2ug3[/url] shared file links: 1 - [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?7m41u99fcbmpocw]http://www.mediafire.com/?7m41u99fcbmpocw[/url] and 2 - [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?5t1nai0b92m6hzi]http://www.mediafire.com/?5t1nai0b92m6hzi[/url] and if u want the direct lint to the files: 1-[url=http://download992.mediafire.com/3g7i386bberg/7m41u99fcbmpocw/free_rs_fullscreen.user.js]http://download992.mediafire.com/3g7i386bberg/7m41u99fcbmpocw/free_rs_fullscreen.user.js[/url] and 2-[url=http://download994.mediafire.com/flkl9dv67szg/5t1nai0b92m6hzi/free_rs_fullscreen2.user.js]http://download994.mediafire.com/flkl9dv67szg/5t1nai0b92m6hzi/free_rs_fullscreen2.user.js[/url]
for firefox you must have greasemonkey for you to use userscripts, for google chrome - chrome has it built in so when u download it chrome asks if u want to install the extension so click yes. for safari follow the guide at lifehacker.com([url=http://lifehacker.com/322641/install-greasemonkey-scripts-in-safari-with-greasekit]http://lifehacker.com/322641/install-greasemonkey-scripts-in-safari-with-greasekit[/url]) and u will have to open the userscript file in safari to install the script.
this is safe. its just javascript if u want to look over it u can. idk if scanning a javascript file can find a virus. but im pretty sure if u knew how u could make malicious code with javascript but i dont have that skill or would i want to do that. im sure this will become obsolete when jagex changes there page but for right now its working. i believe i know ways jagex could enforce their little rule about the removing the ads but dont want them to know. but im pretty sure they have to knowledge of how to do that but idk why they dont. any nice comments would be nice. e.i. things that i could of done to make the code better maybe. i didnt document or convention my code b/c its not a project or what not. ok thanks for reading.

item.title: Runescape webclient fullscreen for non-members. userscript
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:368358”][quote author=xryz link=topic=464510.msg3397124#msg3397124 date=1289535132]
and ok thx, Moparisthebest.

edit: in chrome i turned of javascript and the applet didnt do anything. not even the java loading thing. then when i turned java on it loaded up. idk if its my browser or what. i dont remember where but they have a noscript tag somewhere but that wouldnt affect the loading of the applet would it?
[/quote]

You have to leave Java on and turn off Javascript, they are different. Also, go to runescape.com and click through to play runescape again, it takes you to a different page if javascript is turned off.[/quote]

i left java on and just turned javascript off. i can try it again though. if it doesnt work i could make a vid showing what i did and the result.

[quote=“Davidi2, post:9, topic:368358”]Yea, your for loop is pointless.

i++; you might as well have your incrementor be i=i;
for(int i = 0; i < s.length; i = i) {} lol[/quote]

ya, i realized that when i went through the steps again. im thinking doing a while loop, in place of the for loop, is the better option. thx for the comments.

edit since i cant double post:

ok. i turn off just javascript. went to the runescape homepage. clicked the big button to play(take me to the webclient page) the page loads. i see where the java applet is. when it is, is all white. i opened the java console from the java icon in the notification area. this is what was in the console.


Java Plug-in 1.6.0_22
Using JRE version 1.6.0_22-b04 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM
User home directory = C:\Users\Kris
----------------------------------------------------
c:   clear console window
f:   finalize objects on finalization queue
g:   garbage collect
h:   display this help message
l:   dump classloader list
m:   print memory usage
o:   trigger logging
q:   hide console
r:   reload policy configuration
s:   dump system and deployment properties
t:   dump thread list
v:   dump thread stack
x:   clear classloader cache
0-5: set trace level to <n>
----------------------------------------------------


java.net.MalformedURLException: no protocol: loader-1003333968.jar
	at java.net.URL.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.URL.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin.util.GrayBoxPainter.setProgressFilter(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.setupGrayBoxPainter(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.access$600(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source)

exception: name.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: name
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.addJar(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2Manager.loadJarFiles(Unknown Source)

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2

Yea, your for loop is pointless.

i++; you might as well have your incrementor be i=i;
for(int i = 0; i < s.length; i = i) {} lol

Read full topic
item.source: Runescape webclient fullscreen for non-members. userscript

item.title: Runescape webclient fullscreen for non-members. userscript
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:7, topic:368358”][quote author=xryz link=topic=464510.msg3397124#msg3397124 date=1289535132]

for(var i=0;i<s.length;i++){//loops through the array to remove the script tags s[i].parentNode.removeChild(s[i]);//gets the script tag's parent then removes the tag from the parent i--;//decrements i since the array is one less now }

ROFL

whats funny, my code? my documentation? nothing?
[/quote]i++
i–

Endless loops for the win![/quote]
if you read y i did that it makes perfect sense. so it isnt an endless loop unless there is any error removing the script tags or script tags are being added at the same rate they are being removed.

ok. lets say the arrays length is 8. and there is a loop that increments a variable by 1 every loop. this loop repeats as long as the variable is less than the length of the array. every time there is a loop one object is removed from the array, so the length of the array is decremented by 1.

so we now know that every time there is a loop the variable increases by 1 and the array decreases by 1. so that means they will meet in the middle and the array will still exist.

i.e. variable before the loop happens i=0, and s=5
is i < s? yes
1st loop i++, s–
result i=1,s=4
is i < s? yes
2nd loop i++, s–
result i=2, s=3
is i < s? yes
3rd loop
result i = 3, s = 2
is i<s? no
end loop
result s is still 2. we want s to be 0

what i did.

variables i=0, s=3
is i<s? yes
loop i++,s–,i–
result i=0, s=2
is i<s? yes
loop i++, s–, i–
result i=0, s=1
is i<s? yes
loop i++, s–, i–
result i=0, s=0
is i<s? no
end loop
s is what we wanted- 0!

i guess i could of done that an easier way by using a while loop instead. i.e while(s>0)

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape webclient fullscreen for non-members. userscript
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

ok.
script 1:

// ==UserScript==
// @name           free RS fullscreen(script 1/2)
// @namespace      http://userscripts.org/users/
// @description    gives you fullscreen as a RS non-member. u must also have the script "free RS fullscreen(script 2/2)" for this to work. 
// @include        http://www.runescape.com/game.ws*
// ==/UserScript==

window.location = document.getElementsByTagName('frame')[0].src;//redirects to *world*.runescape.com/* what every world and setting the page has set. e.i. world106.runescape.com/,f5

script 2:

// ==UserScript==
// @name           free RS fullscreen(script 2/2)
// @namespace      http://userscripts.org/users/
// @description    second part of RS fullscreen script. u need free RS fullscreen(script 1/2) also. this also removes the ads for your.
// @include        *world*.runescape.com*
// ==/UserScript==

var s = document.getElementsByTagName('script');//sets var s as an array of the script elements in the webpage
for(var i=0;i<s.length;i++){//loops through the array to remove the script tags
s[i].parentNode.removeChild(s[i]);//gets the script tag's parent then removes the tag from the parent
i--;//decrements i since the array is one less now
}//removing the scripts from the page will keep the page from recorrecting itself it seems jagex had functions to detect tampering with the page and it trys to fix them sometimes.
document.getElementById('gametable').childNodes[1].childNodes[0].setAttribute('style','visibility:hidden');//sets the cell's, that contains the ad box(iframe) and menubar, visibility to hidden. so it doesnt overlap the game
document.getElementById('tbi').src="";//sets the ad's iframe src to nothing
document.getElementById('tbi').width="";//sets the ad's iframe width to nothing
document.getElementById('tbi').height="";//sets the ad's iframe height to nothing
//by doing the three above, the width and height dont really matter they are kinda extra, it should not reload the ad and make the game flicker.
document.getElementById("gameframe").setAttribute('style','position:absolute;top:0px;left:0px');//sets the div tag's, that contains the applet, position to 0,0. filling the window with the applet.

if u wanted to do this without the userscripts u could copy and paste this into to address bar.
1.when you open up the client page. i.e www.runescape.com/game.ws* c&p this:

javascript:window.location = document.getElementsByTagName(‘frame’)[0].src;

that will redirect you to the ?server? page

  1. c&p this into address bar:

javascript:var s=document.getElementsByTagName(‘script’);for(var si=0;si<s.length;si++){s[si].parentNode.removeChild(s[si]);si–;}document.getElementById(‘gametable’).childNodes[1].childNodes[0].setAttribute(‘style’,‘visibility:hidden’);document.getElementById(‘tbi’).src="";document.getElementById(‘tbi’).width="";document.getElementById(‘tbi’).height="";document.getElementById(“gameframe”).setAttribute(‘style’,‘position:absolute;top:0px;left:0px’);

for some reason there is a filter filtering out “i” when its between square brackets(’[’+i+’]’). so since that wasnt showing up i changed “i” to “si”.

there it is with out using the userscript files.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

i got bored yesterday so i decided to mess around. i hope this isnt breaking the rules since this is javascript and not a higher-level programming language.

all this stuff in this paragraph really isnt important if u dont want to read it just skip on down to the next paragraph. well right now in my college class we are doing a little bit of javascripting. not really anything just getting use familiar with the way programming is b4 we actually learn how to program(right now the course is still learning about computer and Internet concepts). not saying im just now learning this stuff its just review b/c when i first got interested in programming from this site here, i really was a noob. kept trying to learn java, but didnt want to take the time to read through the tuts and stuff. so i read shorter tuts on w3schools.com about html and javascript. so for the stuff we are doing right now im a little advanced for but thats cool its an easy A; but i am learning little things here and there. i am not saying i know everything, b/c i am far from that. i am learning every day which we should all do. sorry for the little story i get side tracked easy.

ok. like the title says i created a userscript that redirects you to the src of the iframe in the www.runescape.com/game.ws page, then removes the scripts from that new page, removes the ads src, resizes the ad, hides the ad area and menubar, and finally sets the position of the applet to 0,0. for this to work u must have both userscripts for this to work and you must also have your client set to resizable. u can leave the web browser like that or hit f11 or click the button to make it fullscreen.

share folder link: http://www.mediafire.com/?ugbmat37g2ug3
shared file links: 1 - http://www.mediafire.com/?7m41u99fcbmpocw and 2 - http://www.mediafire.com/?5t1nai0b92m6hzi
and if u want the direct lint to the files: 1-http://download992.mediafire.com/3g7i386bberg/7m41u99fcbmpocw/free_rs_fullscreen.user.js and 2-http://download994.mediafire.com/flkl9dv67szg/5t1nai0b92m6hzi/free_rs_fullscreen2.user.js

for firefox you must have greasemonkey for you to use userscripts, for google chrome - chrome has it built in so when u download it chrome asks if u want to install the extension so click yes. for safari follow the guide at lifehacker.com(http://lifehacker.com/322641/install-greasemonkey-scripts-in-safari-with-greasekit) and u will have to open the userscript file in safari to install the script.

this is safe. its just javascript if u want to look over it u can. idk if scanning a javascript file can find a virus. but im pretty sure if u knew how u could make malicious code with javascript but i dont have that skill or would i want to do that. im sure this will become obsolete when jagex changes there page but for right now its working. i believe i know ways jagex could enforce their little rule about the removing the ads but dont want them to know. but im pretty sure they have to knowledge of how to do that but idk why they dont. any nice comments would be nice. e.i. things that i could of done to make the code better maybe. i didnt document or convention my code b/c its not a project or what not. ok thanks for reading.
